[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_type_actuals()] [Type Instantiation] At lines 3588-3596, type actuals are retrieved from bytecode signatures. Can an attacker exploit None SignatureIndex to bypass type parameter validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_constant_value()] [Deserialization Attack] At line 3610, VMConstant::deserialize_constant unwraps without error handling. Can an attacker craft malformed constant bytecode that causes deserialization panics or produces invalid MoveValue? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_constant()] [Index Validation] At line 3604, constant pool is accessed by index without bounds checking. Can an attacker provide invalid ConstantPoolIndex to access out-of-bounds memory or cause panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_spec_block()] [Spec Target Validation] At lines 2250-2272, certain spec block targets panic if accessed. Can an attacker trigger these panics by creating invalid SpecBlockTarget references? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_modify_targets()] [Modifies Clause Handling] At lines 5163-5180, modify targets are extracted without validating the instantiation. Can an attacker craft modifies clauses with invalid type instantiations to bypass memory access checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: is_explicitly_not_verified()] [Verification Exclusion] At line 5217, explicit non-verification is checked via pragma. Can an attacker exploit this to disable verification of security-critical functions by injecting verify=false pragmas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_bytecode()] [Bytecode Access] At lines 4743-4750, bytecode is retrieved without validating the function has a definition. Can an attacker access bytecode of native functions or cause panics by accessing undefined def_idx? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_bytecode_loc()] [Location Mapping] At lines 4730-4738, bytecode offsets are mapped to source locations. Can an attacker manipulate source_map to map bytecode to misleading source locations, hiding malicious code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: is_well_known()] [Well-Known Detection] At lines 4853-4861, well-known functions are detected by name and address. Can an attacker create functions with well-known names at non-standard addresses to bypass special handling? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: is_intrinsic()] [Intrinsic Detection] At lines 4827-4834, intrinsic detection uses pragma with fallback to intrinsics registry. Can an attacker exploit the fallback to mark non-intrinsic functions as intrinsic and bypass safety checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: add()] [Module Registration] At lines 1574-1635, modules are added to module_data vector. Can an attacker exploit the RawIndex cast at line 1611 to cause module_id collisions if more than 65535 modules are registered? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: add_function_def()] [Function Addition] At lines 2098-2150, functions are added with assertion they don't exist. Can race conditions cause the assertion to pass for two concurrent additions, allowing duplicate function registration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: set_function_def()] [Definition Override] At lines 2064-2083, function definitions are overridden and caches are reset. Can an attacker exploit cache reset timing to cause stale cached values to be used before reset completes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: filter_functions()] [Function Filtering] At lines 2633-2653, functions are filtered with predicate. Can an attacker exploit incomplete filtering where some caches retain references to filtered functions, causing use-after-filter bugs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: treat_everything_as_target()] [Target Override] At line 719, everything_is_target flag can be set. Can an attacker exploit this during verification to mark dependencies as targets and alter verification behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: find_module()] [Module Lookup] At lines 1955-1965, modules are found by linear search. Can an attacker exploit O(n) lookup complexity with thousands of modules to cause DoS during module resolution? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: get_enclosing_span()] [Span Validation] At line 2050, span enclosure is checked without validating the spans are from the same file. Can an attacker exploit cross-file span comparisons to cause incorrect enclosure detection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: Loc::enclosing()] [Empty Location Set] At line 184, the function asserts locs is not empty. Can an attacker trigger panic by passing empty location vectors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Field: diags RefCell] [Concurrent Diagnostics] At line 571, diags is stored in RefCell. In multi-threaded verification, can concurrent diagnostic additions cause borrow_mut panics or data races? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Field: exp_info RefCell] [Expression Info Race] At line 577, exp_info is RefCell-protected. Can concurrent node allocations or type updates cause borrow conflicts or inconsistent type information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Field: extensions RefCell] [Extension Race] At line 594, extensions use RefCell. Can concurrent extension access cause borrow panics during parallel verification? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Field: module_spec RefCell] [Spec Modification Race] At line 3021, module_spec is RefCell. Can concurrent spec queries and modifications cause borrow conflicts during verification? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: new_node()] [Node ID Space Exhaustion] At line 2459, checked_add is used for node ID increment. Once maximum usize is reached, is verification gracefully terminated or do subsequent nodes get incorrect IDs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Struct: RawIndex] [16-bit Index Limitation] RawIndex is u16 at line 239, limiting modules/functions to 65535. Can an attacker exploit this by registering maximum functions to cause index overflow and function ID collisions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-model/src/model.rs] [Function: file_id_to_idx()] [FileId Mapping Exhaustion] At line 846, file_idx is u16. Can an attacker cause file ID mapping collisions by adding more than 65535 source files? (Low)
